meanings.definition: The condition or status of being a thane.
meanings.sent1: In the kingdom, his thenage granted him respect and authority.
meanings.sent2: The thenage of the nobleman was evident in his regal demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The thenage of the knight made him the envy of all the other warriors.
meanings.sent4: Her thenage among the villagers was akin to that of a queen among her subjects.
meanings.sent5: The thenage of the leader shone brightly in the eyes of his followers.

meanings.definition: The office or rank of a thane.
meanings.sent1: He was proud to hold the thenage of chief advisor to the king.
meanings.sent2: The thenage of lordship came with great responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The thenage of being the head of the council was both an honor and a burden.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of business, her thenage as CEO was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The thenage of captaincy required strong leadership skills.

meanings.definition: The land or property held by a thane.
meanings.sent1: The vast thenage of the baron stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: The valuable thenage of the estate was well-maintained.
meanings.sent3: The thenage of the manor was the envy of all neighboring landowners.
meanings.sent4: His thenage included fertile fields and lush forests.
meanings.sent5: The thenage of the castle was a symbol of his wealth and power.
